## unwrapOr() function

Unwraps a value and ensures it is not null or undefined.

Inspired by rust's `unwrap_or` function.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare function unwrapOr<T, F>(maybe: T, fallback: F): UnwrapResult<T, F>;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

maybe


</td><td>

T


</td><td>

The value to unwrap


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

fallback


</td><td>

F


</td><td>

The default value to return if input is null or undefined


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
**Returns:**

[UnwrapResult](./toolkit.unwrapresult.md)<!-- -->&lt;T, F&gt;

The input value if it exists, otherwise the default value

## Example 1


```ts
function fetchUser(): Promise<User | null> { ... }

const user = await fetchUser(); // Promise<User | null>
const name = unwrapOr(user.name, "Unknown"); // string
```

## Example 2


```ts
const details = unwrapOr(
  document.querySelector("details"),
  new Error("Element not found")
); // HTMLDetailsElement
```
